property.name: dfs.name.dir
property.description: Determines where on the local filesystem the DFS name node should store the name table. If this is a comma-delimited list of directories then the name table is replicated in all of the directories, for redundancy.

property.name: dfs.data.dir
property.description: Determines where on the local filesystem an DFS data node should store its blocks. If this is a comma-delimited list of directories, then data will be stored in all named directories, typically on different devices. Directories that do not exist are ignored.

property.name: dfs.safemode.threshold.pct
property.description: Specifies the percentage of blocks that should satisfy the minimal replication requirement defined by dfs.replication.min. Values less than or equal to 0 mean not to start in safe mode. Values greater than 1 will make safe mode permanent.

property.name: dfs.http.address
property.description: The name of the default file system. Either the literal string "local" or a host:port for NDFS.

property.name: dfs.umaskmode
property.description: The octal umask used when creating files and directories.

property.name: dfs.block.access.token.enable
property.description: Are access tokens are used as capabilities for accessing datanodes.

property.name: dfs.namenode.kerberos.principal
property.description: Kerberos principal name for the NameNode

property.name: dfs.secondary.namenode.kerberos.principal
property.description: Kerberos principal name for the secondary NameNode.

property.name: dfs.namenode.kerberos.https.principal
property.description: The Kerberos principal for the host that the NameNode runs on.

property.name: dfs.secondary.namenode.kerberos.https.principal
property.description: The Kerberos principal for the hostthat the secondary NameNode runs on.

property.name: dfs.secondary.https.port
property.description: The https port where secondary-namenode binds

property.name: dfs.datanode.kerberos.principal
property.description: The Kerberos principal that the DataNode runs as. "_HOST" is replaced by the real host name.

property.name: dfs.web.authentication.kerberos.principal
property.description:
The HTTP Kerberos principal used by Hadoop-Auth in the HTTP endpoint.
The HTTP Kerberos principal MUST start with 'HTTP/' per Kerberos HTTP SPNEGO specification.

property.name: dfs.web.authentication.kerberos.keytab
property.description: The Kerberos keytab file with the credentials for the HTTP Kerberos principal used by Hadoop-Auth in the HTTP endpoint.

property.name: dfs.namenode.keytab.file
property.description: Combined keytab file containing the namenode service and host principals.

property.name: dfs.secondary.namenode.keytab.file
property.description: Combined keytab file containing the namenode service and host principals.

property.name: dfs.datanode.keytab.file
property.description: The filename of the keytab file for the DataNode.

property.name: dfs.https.port
property.description: The https port where namenode binds

property.name: dfs.https.address
property.description: The https address where namenode binds

property.name: dfs.datanode.data.dir.perm
property.description: The permissions that should be there on dfs.data.dir directories. The datanode will not come up if the permissions are different on existing dfs.data.dir directories. If the directories don't exist, they will be created with this permission.

property.name: dfs.cluster.administrators
property.description: ACL for who all can view the default servlets in the HDFS

property.name: dfs.permissions.superusergroup
property.description: The name of the group of super-users.

property.name: dfs.secondary.http.address
property.description: The secondary namenode http server address and port. If the port is 0 then the server will start on a free port.

property.name: dfs.hosts
property.description: Names a file that contains a list of hosts that are permitted to connect to the namenode. The full pathname of the file must be specified. If the value is empty, all hosts are permitted.

property.name: dfs.hosts.exclude
property.description: Names a file that contains a list of hosts that are not permitted to connect to the namenode. The full pathname of the file must be specified. If the value is empty, no hosts are excluded.

property.name: dfs.webhdfs.enabled
property.description: Enable or disable webhdfs. Defaults to false

property.name: dfs.support.append
property.description: Enable or disable append. Defaults to false
